intro: Rorippa mandonii, commonly known as the Mediterranean watercress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Europe and is often found in moist environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. The plant has alternate, pinnately lobed leaves that are typically submerged or floating. Its small, white flowers appear in clusters and are followed by pods that contain several seeds. Rorippa mandonii is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
